Title: Ballroom Dance Beginner Lessons
Description:
Ballroom Dance Beginner Lessons
Join us for our beginner lessons! We teach you how to waltz, tango, cha-cha, and much more! It doesn't matter if you've never danced; if you're interested in learning, please join! Don't worry if you don't have a partner either, we make sure no one dances alone. You are welcome to join at any point during the year and still gain a good understanding of what’s happening. Don’t worry if you’ve never danced before because this is geared toward absolute beginners. All you need is a pair of socks and yourself!
 
Tuesday Lessons: These lessons focus on learning to dance with another individual and the basics of moving around the social dance floor. We alternate styles on Tuesday each week, beginning with Latin dancing such as cha-cha, rumba, and swing and switching to smooth, which is more the waltz and tango dances. The lesson goes from 7 to 8 p.m., and we leave time for dancers to practice social dancing on their own from 8 to 9 p.m.
 
Wednesday Lessons: The Wednesday lessons will begin with a Latin-style dance lesson from 7 to 8 p.m. and a standard-style lesson from 8 to 9 p.m. These lessons focus more on technique and learning how to move your body. They will be beginner-friendly but get a little bit harder as time goes on. 
After the dues deadline (9/27), they are members-only, so please make sure to talk to a council member if you want to try it out!
 
Getting In Touch: If you're interested in learning more about the team, you can email us at ycguan@ad.unc.edu or join our listserv here: https://forms.gle/i1VADq7u4jaEZU7P9


      From Tuesday, December 3, 2024 7:00 PM

      at Woollen Room B019.

Title: This is America I - Johnny Gandelsman, violin and Curator-in-Residence
Description:
This is America I - Johnny Gandelsman, violin and Curator-in-Residence
Violinist and producer Johnny Gandelsman developed This is America in 2020, out of a time of rupture and disconnection.  Thinking about ways that one person could make a small difference, he brought together commissioning partners across 11 states and territories to commission 22 new works.  He invited the composers, all US-based, to reflect on the time we’re all living in.  Since that initial burst of creativity This is America has been performed throughout North America and grown to encompass 28 compositions for solo violin.  “This is America celebrates America’s rich cultural tapestry and its myriad perspectives, thoughts and ideas, offering a vivid counterpoint to the idea that this land can be understood through a singular, dominant point of view.  Each composition reflects on the current state of American society in a personal and intimate way, looking through an unflinching lens at universal topics like separation, loneliness, hope and love.” – Johnny Gandelsman 
This is the first performance of a five-part series.
Ticket purchase required; more information here: https://tickets.carolinaperformingarts.org/events


      From Friday, December 13, 2024 8:00 PM
      to 10:00 PM EST
      at CURRENT ArtSpace.

Title: Mindful Meditation by Bhakti Yoga Club of UNC-CH
Description:
Mindful Meditation by Bhakti Yoga Club of UNC-CH
Mindful meditation is a key practice of Bhakti Yoga. Original Yoga practices were made to help one control their thoughts and actions through raising awareness and self-regulation. Yoga from ancient India was originally meant for the mind before it was popularized as a physical activity. The UNC Bhakti Yoga club is working to help students experience these same fulfilling feelings through mindful meditation.


The Bhakti Yoga Club is committed to creating a stress-relieving and welcoming environment. Free vegan treats will be provided to session participants. All are welcome!The main session runs from 7-8 P.M. Participants are welcome to stay (from 8-8:30 P.M.) after the main session, to enjoy some snacks and interact with other particiapnts.Notes:You do not need to RSVP to attend! We only use the RSVP headcount as an estimate so we know how much food to bring (+ so we can have extras for everyone).You do not need a yoga mat (this is not physical exercise). You are welcome to stay as long as you like during the sessions. You also do not need to have attended previous sessions to show up to an upcoming one. Feel free to come and see how you feel.




      From Monday, January 13, 2025 7:00 PM
      to 8:00 PM EST
      at Carolina Student Union #2424.

Title: Mindful Meditation by Bhakti Yoga Club of UNC-CH
Description:
Mindful Meditation by Bhakti Yoga Club of UNC-CH
Mindful meditation is a key practice of Bhakti Yoga. Original Yoga practices were made to help one control their thoughts and actions through raising awareness and self-regulation. Yoga from ancient India was originally meant for the mind before it was popularized as a physical activity. The UNC Bhakti Yoga club is working to help students experience these same fulfilling feelings through mindful meditation.


The Bhakti Yoga Club is committed to creating a stress-relieving and welcoming environment. Free vegan treats will be provided to session participants. All are welcome!The main session runs from 7-8 P.M. Participants are welcome to stay (from 8-8:30 P.M.) after the main session, to enjoy some snacks and interact with other particiapnts.Notes:You do not need to RSVP to attend! We only use the RSVP headcount as an estimate so we know how much food to bring (+ so we can have extras for everyone).You do not need a yoga mat (this is not physical exercise). You are welcome to stay as long as you like during the sessions. You also do not need to have attended previous sessions to show up to an upcoming one. Feel free to come and see how you feel.




      From Monday, January 27, 2025 7:00 PM
      to 8:00 PM EST
      at Carolina Student Union #2424.

Title: George Washington Physician Assistant Program Admissions Panel and Q&A
Description:
George Washington Physician Assistant Program Admissions Panel and Q&A
Join us for an engaging panel discussion featuring the admissions team from the George Washington PA Program! This event offers a unique opportunity to gain firsthand insights into the PA program, student life, and the journey toward becoming a healthcare professional. Our panelists will offer advice for prospective students on patient care experiences, shadowing, pre-requisite courses, and more! Whether you're considering applying to the PA program or simply curious about the profession, this session is an excellent chance to ask questions and connect with those who are living the PA experience.
 
The Carolina Pre-Physician Assistant Association is a student-run organization that focuses on the academic, social, and service interests of pre-PA students at UNC Chapel Hill. Our goals are to educate students on the process of applying to PA programs, support undergraduate students through pre-requisite courses and patient care experiences, and connect students with practicing PAs through shadowing. In the past, we have hosted PA student panels, PA program representative panels, and provided shadowing and volunteer opportunities. 


      From Tuesday, January 28, 2025 7:00 PM
      to 8:00 PM EST
      at Online.
Author: lmccain@unc.edu (Carolina Pre-Physician Assistant Association)

Title: Freshley:  First-Year Small Group
Description:
Freshley:  First-Year Small Group
Freshley is all about helping you find your place in God’s story, at Carolina, and in Wesley.  Each week will begin with ice breakers and games to help you meet other first-years, and then the Freshley Team will lead a small group time to connect Scripture to your life as a first-year student.  Plus, your Freshley Leaders are here to answer all your questions and help you transition to college.
All First-Years are invited!
Have a lab until 8?  Please come after!  You won't be interrupting anything, we promise!
Freshley meets in the Wesley Building (201 E. Rosemary Street).  It's the yellow building on the corner of Rosemary and Henderson Streets, right across from Tru Deli.
For more info and to meet the Freshley Leaders, check out uncwesley.org/freshley or the UNC Wesley App


      From Wednesday, January 29, 2025 8:00 PM
      to 9:30 PM EST
      at Wesley Building.
Author: spurrier@live.unc.edu (Wesley Campus Ministry at UNC-Chapel Hill)
Attendees: spurrier@live.unc.edu (Wesley Campus Ministry at UNC-Chapel Hill)

Title: Night Sky with Exit Wounds
Description:
Night Sky with Exit Wounds
New York City based theater, opera, and film artist Kaneza Schaal returns following her 2023 direction of Rhiannon Giddens’ and Michael Abels’ Pulitzer Prize winning opera Omar with a new Carolina Performing Arts co-commissioned work-in-progress that features music from Bryce Dessner and marks the first adaptation of the work of Vietnamese American poet, essayist, and novelist Ocean Vuong. 
Journey through the memory of war via the poetic cosmos of Ocean Vuong’s masterpiece Night Sky with Exit Wounds. This is a multi-disciplinary experience conceived by director Kaneza Schaal and composer Bryce Dessner, set for premiere in 2026. With Schaal and Dessner navigating the delicate balance between the raw vulnerability of Vuong’s poetry and the dynamic interplay of music and visuals, the collaborators embark on an exploration that transcends conventional design boundaries toward a universe where live music, poetry and visual art find a seamless, deeply charged flow. 
Ticket purchase required; more information here: https://tickets.carolinaperformingarts.org/events


      From Thursday, January 30, 2025 7:30 PM
      to 9:30 PM EST
      at CURRENT ArtSpace.
Author: carolinaperformingarts@unc.edu (Carolina Performing Arts)

Title: Ethics Around the Table with Rebecca Walker
Description:
Ethics Around the Table with Rebecca Walker
The Parr Center presents Ethics Around the Table with Rebecca Walker (UNC School of Social Medicine and UNC Philosophy)
Dr. Walker’s current work focuses on biomedical research including animal research, phase I healthy volunteer research, and genomic advances. She also works on topics in health care ethics including distributive justice and concepts of autonomy. Dr. Walker completed a Greenwall Foundation post-doctoral fellowship in bioethics and health policy at Johns Hopkins University in 2001.
More information about this event will be made available in Spring 2025. 


      From Tuesday, February 4, 2025 12:30 PM
      to 1:30 PM EST
      at Toy Lounge in Dey Hall.
Author: parrcenter@unc.edu (Parr Center for Ethics)

Title: Pathways in Psychology: Alumni Insights & Career Journeys
Description:
Pathways in Psychology: Alumni Insights & Career Journeys
Pathways in Psychology: Alumni Insights & Career Journeys offers students a unique opportunity to explore the diverse career possibilities within psychology. Hear directly from successful alumni who have transformed their psychology degrees into impactful careers. Panelists will share their professional journeys, discuss challenges and rewards, and offer practical advice on navigating the path from college to career. Whether you’re considering further studies or entering the workforce, this event provides valuable insights to help you make informed career decisions.


      From Friday, February 7, 2025 10:00 AM
      to 11:00 AM EST
      at Online.
Author: ucs@unc.edu (University Career Services)
